title: Colon file handling
body:
Hi,

I seem to be unable to make rclone attempt to copy a directory containing a colon character in it's name, bug or user? :) It seems to be interpreting the colon as a config fragment for the endpoint name.

> What is your rclone version (eg output from `rclone -V`)

rclone v1.36-22-gbc25190β & rclone v1.36

> Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)
Linux x64

> Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)
Amazon Cloud Drive

> The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
> A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (eg output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

```
$ mkdir "test:directory" ; touch "test:directory/test.file.txt"

$ ./rclone -vv copy "test:directory" "acd-data:.tmp/test:directory/"
2017/04/14 16:33:08 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.36-22-gbc25190β" starting with parameters ["./rclone" "-vv" "copy" "test:directory" "acd-data:.tmp/test:directory/"]
2017/04/14 16:33:08 Failed to create file system for "test:directory": didn't find section in config file

$ ./rclone -vv copy "test:directory" "acd-data:.tmp/"
2017/04/14 16:33:36 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.36-22-gbc25190β" starting with parameters ["./rclone" "-vv" "copy" "test:directory" "acd-data:.tmp/"]
2017/04/14 16:33:36 Failed to create file system for "test:directory": didn't find section in config file

$ ./rclone -vv copy 'test:directory' acd-data:.tmp/
2017/04/14 16:34:00 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.36-22-gbc25190β" starting with parameters ["./rclone" "-vv" "copy" "test:directory" "acd-data:.tmp/"]
2017/04/14 16:34:00 Failed to create file system for "test:directory": didn't find section in config file

$ ./rclone -vv copy test\:directory acd:.tmp/
2017/04/14 16:38:39 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.36-22-gbc25190β" starting with parameters ["./rclone" "-vv" "copy" "test:directory" "acd:.tmp/"]
2017/04/14 16:38:39 Failed to create file system for "test:directory": didn't find section in config file

$ ./rclone -vv copy test\\:directory acd:.tmp/
2017/04/14 16:38:43 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.36-22-gbc25190β" starting with parameters ["./rclone" "-vv" "copy" "test\\:directory" "acd:.tmp/"]
2017/04/14 16:38:44 INFO  : amazon drive root '.tmp': Modify window not supported
2017/04/14 16:38:44 DEBUG : amazon drive root '.tmp': Reading ""
2017/04/14 16:38:44 DEBUG : amazon drive root '.tmp': Finished reading ""
2017/04/14 16:38:44 INFO  : amazon drive root '.tmp': Waiting for checks to finish
2017/04/14 16:38:44 INFO  : amazon drive root '.tmp': Waiting for transfers to finish
2017/04/14 16:38:44 ERROR : Attempt 1/3 failed with 0 errors and: error reading source directory "": directory not found
2017/04/14 16:38:44 DEBUG : amazon drive root '.tmp': Reading ""
2017/04/14 16:38:44 DEBUG : amazon drive root '.tmp': Finished reading ""
2017/04/14 16:38:44 INFO  : amazon drive root '.tmp': Waiting for checks to finish
2017/04/14 16:38:44 INFO  : amazon drive root '.tmp': Waiting for transfers to finish
2017/04/14 16:38:44 ERROR : Attempt 2/3 failed with 0 errors and: error reading source directory "": directory not found
2017/04/14 16:38:44 DEBUG : amazon drive root '.tmp': Reading ""
2017/04/14 16:38:44 DEBUG : amazon drive root '.tmp': Finished reading ""
2017/04/14 16:38:44 INFO  : amazon drive root '.tmp': Waiting for checks to finish
2017/04/14 16:38:44 INFO  : amazon drive root '.tmp': Waiting for transfers to finish
2017/04/14 16:38:44 ERROR : Attempt 3/3 failed with 0 errors and: error reading source directory "": directory not found
2017/04/14 16:38:44 Failed to copy: error reading source directory "": directory not found

# To prove the endpoints actually exist...
$ ./rclone ls acd-data:.tmp ; echo $?
0
$ ./rclone ls acd:.tmp ; echo $?
0

``` 


Any ideas?

Thanks!
